description: The ISM330IS is a 6‑axis inertial measurement unit (IMU) system‑in‑package featuring a 3‑axis digital accelerometer and a 3‑axis digital gyroscope. It includes an ultra‑low‑power intelligent sensor processing unit (ISPU) for on‑edge AI and a sensor hub that can interface up to four external sensors. The device operates from 1.71 V to 3.6 V (analog) with an independent 1.62 V to 3.6 V IO supply, supports SPI and I²C serial interfaces, and is available in a compact LGA‑14L package (2.5 × 3.0 × 0.83 mm).
application_examples: Event detection in alarms and smart homes
Complex motion detection and gesture recognition for personal health

specifications.measuring_range: Accelerometer: ±2 g / ±4 g / ±8 g / ±16 g; Gyroscope: ±125 dps / ±250 dps / ±500 dps / ±1000 dps / ±2000 dps
specifications.operating_voltage: 1.71 V to 3.6 V (analog), 1.62 V to 3.6 V (IO)
specifications.interface: SPI (3‑ or 4‑wire) and I²C (fast mode 400 kHz, fast‑mode‑plus 1 MHz)
other: Sensor hub capable of reading up to four external sensors

power.supply_voltage_range: 1.71 V to 3.6 V (analog), 1.62 V to 3.6 V (IO)

pins.Other: CS, SCL, SDA, INT1, INT2, Vdd_IO, GND, GND, Vdd, INT1, INT2, RES, RES, CS, SCL, SDA

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect Vdd to 1.71–3.6 V, Vdd_IO to 1.62–3.6 V, GND to ground. For I²C, pull‑up the SDA and SCL lines to Vdd_IO. For SPI, connect CS, SCL (SPC), SDI, and SDO. INT1 and INT2 are programmable interrupt pins. The device supports both 3‑wire and 4‑wire SPI modes.
